values:
Name: Laurel 

Age/D.O.B.: 
21 3/5/87

e-mail: 
lady at warren-wilson dot edu

Location: 
Asheville, NC and Myersville, MD

Do you swap/collect anything?: 
Post cards, found items, letters

What are your hobbies? 
Letter writing, hiking, singing poorly, selling children's toys, taking kids on nature walks, talking with my mother, eating avocados, taking Polaroids (although this is becoming increasingly more expensive). 

Favorite:
music? Modest Mouse, Animal Collective, The Mountain Goats, Rilo Kiley, etc.

movies? Waking Ned Devine, Fern Gully, Amelie, and others

books? Cannery Row, The Alchemist, Hope for the Flowers

anything else you would like to share?

I'm an outdoor leadership major and I like to go to Star Island.

School is done tomorrow. I'm in the middle of a self-reflection paper and a social justice tool box, both for my Universal Programming for Adventure Education class. I really love Marty, but she assigns a ton of work for her classes. It's worthwhile, though, for sure. 

The suite that we thought we had lost we've actually got. Good things. 

I've got an incredible craving for chocolate, but I feel like if I eat anything I might vomit. An interesting combination.

Found out last week that I don't have to stay for an extra semester, which means that I will graduate next May. This makes me very, very happy. 

But I also found out last week that the suite I was going to live with with my amazing future roommate and amazing future suite mates was given away, even though we had squatter's rights and had asked well before the deadline to have it. So now we're all sort of in a limbo in terms of where we're going to live, which is no bueno. 

I will see Jon in 5 days. This is very good. Jon, in general, is very good. 

I watched Silence of the Lambs last night. It was pretty good. I woke up at like, 5, after having dreams that Dr. Lector was coming to Dancing Bear to eat all of the employees. Mmm, toy store girls. 

uuuh, end.

Dear UUA, 
Blow me. I don't want to be your friend anymore. 
Laurel

PS- How are we supposed to "Mind the Gap" if there's no one to fill it? Think about it, morons.

I can't remember when the last time I posted here was, or what it was that I posted about. I suppose I could look at past entries to avoid repetition, but I'm feeling lazy. 
Jon is here and is sick. Kaitlin was sick all last week, and I believe I have caught something. Also, my left lower eye lid is read and puffy and hurting. I don't know what's up with all that, but I plan on having it looked at tomorrow. 
I am horribly procrastinating writing the schedule for my program. I need a detailed map of the Maryland section of the AT, but I don't have one. Oh well. 
I'm moving back on campus next year. I don't really know how to tell Kaitlin that this is happening. I think she'll be upset. But I think that it will work out better for me, and that we are better friends when we don't live together. 
Jon is considering moving to Asheville. But he's also considering finishing his paralegal degree in Seattle, or taking a federal job in Baltimore. I mostly just want him to be happy, but I'd really like it if he moved here. 
My birthday is sort of soon. Woo? It's not going to be much different to be 21. Not drinking will happen then too. 
Um. End.
Delayed flights are no fun, but hopefully Ecuador will be.

I should be working on this amazingly important assignment, but I'm not, I'm being distracted instead. I'm also waiting for a call from my new friend Hank, because when this call happens it means that we're going to the Asiana Buffet with some of his roommates from school. I have never hung out with Hank before, and I don't know who is roommates are, but I sure hope they think I'm cool enough to be friends with Hank. 

I hope that Hank doesn't think that I asked to hang out with him because I'd like to pursue some sort of romantic relationship. I hope that's not too presumptuous to say. I just think he's neat and I want to get to know him, to be his friend. I can't remember the last time I asked a guy that I don't really know that well to hang out with me without the pretext of a possible romance. Have I ever asked a guy I don't really know that well to hang out with me without the pretext of a possible romance? I don't know. 

I think Brian and Kaitlin and I are going to have an ice cream social on Wednesday to celebrate the semester's end. Jon will be here and there are not many things that I love more than Jon and ice cream. 

I'm so thrilled that loving Jon is going to swimmingly.

Going home on Thursday. Taking the Blue Ridge Parkway, which should prove to be windy, long, and pretty. 

Umm. Does anyone want to come up with 20 hours of watershed-oriented service for 4th graders for me? Kay thanks.

In one week Jon will be here. In one week from Thursday we will begin our trek up the Blue Ridge Parkway toward my home, where he will leave for his parents' house in Suffolk County. In two weeks we will be on a plane to Ecuador. Holy shit. 
I still can't believe that we're actually doing this. I remember when he told me that he was thinking of going to South America for the winter to learn Spanish/have an adventure, and the smile he had on his face when he asked me to go with him. And we're really doing it. 
He told me that he might move to Asheville in 6-8 months. I told him that I really, really like the idea. It would be pretty amazing to live in the same city. We could laugh and cuddle and take hikes and make dinner together all the time. It sounds pretty nice to me. 
Gush gush gush. All I wanna do is gush.

I live in Ashville, North Carolina. Yessss. 
We got to move in a day early. My bed is wicked comfortable and I've unpacked alla my clothes (of which, I and Brian and Kaitlin have established, there are far too many articles). We bought a couch and a small shelf and are in the middle of decorating everything. That's gonna take a super long time. I have so much stuff I like on the walls. Most of them pictures, and most from Star/Star related events. Woo. 

School starts on Monday, which means that I leave for the woods very, very soon. This is very, very scary/super exciting. 

Kaitlin just asked me if I'm familiar with a band called Sisters with Hammers. 

Can I talk about Jon now? 'Cause I'm gonna. Can I say how fucking amazing he is? And how no one-not a single person, ever- has made me feel the way that he does? Tyler was great (at first, anyway), but Jon surpasses everything that I had with him. And the fact that he lives in Seattle doesn't bother me at all. I mean, yeah, it sucks a little, but the emotions that are swimming around in me are just fucking incredible. Aaahhh happymushygiggleyglitterrainbowsandponies. Good things. 

Okay. Gotta get things done. I want to paint today and put some things up. Woo!

Love and stuff.

"Dance parties, big bucket margurita mixed" That was the last saved thing that I had written. I just barely remember when that was. It's been a super long time. Like, 20 weeks or something. Shoooot me. Life is so good right now. I had a great summer working at camp and at Kenzie's, I met and worked with some really incredible people, Star was amazing even though the island was closed and we had to have the conference somewhere else, I'm falling in love with an absolutely remarkable person, and in a week I'm going on a 48 day backpacking/WFR/rock climbing/white water extravanganza. I go back to Asheville tomorrow and move in with Brian and Kaitlin on Thursday. This has been a summer of finding new friendships, strengthening old ones, finding out a ton more about myself, and just generally having a good time. It's so nice to say, "I'm awesome!" when people ask how I am. I'm really proud of myself for taking the risk of applying to Wilson without really knowing anything about it. It was scary and exciting and exactly what I needed. I finally feel at home. I love home.

So it's been a while. 

Spent a week in merry land, and then a weekend in RI for the staff meeting. It was all mostly really great. Getting home sucked, though I'm pretty much over it and won't complain. 

Made up with a friend today. That was great, too. 

Didn't do a lot of homework that I needed to. Not so great, but did things that I needed to do for me, so it all sort of works out. 

I'm wearing a fancy felt hat.

There's a ton to say, but what it all boils down to, really, is this list:

-overwhelming amounts of school work
-amazing people
-heartache
-pretty days
-playing camp games during class
-connections
 and last, but not least, the continuous search for truth and meaning in my life.

Will be home in a week with Brian and Kaitlin and Todd. Brian and Kaitlin and I are going to a Michael Franti and Spearhead show in Baltimore while Todd hangs out with some of his friends, and then all four of us are trucking it back to Myersville. I kind of can't wait. It'll be nice to be home and have time to relax. I'd like to take a couple of days to drive down to Salisbury to visit Laurel, but I'm not sure if I'll be able to. 

Dunno if I should call Jeff or not. We haven't spoken in over a month, and I'm not sure why. It's hard for me to call people here; it's been really easy to get wrapped up in things. The only people I call on a regular basis are my parents and Tyler. And that's only once or twice a week. Meh. We'll see. 

Birthday went well. I am now officially in the throes of emerging adulthood. Whatever that means. 

Trying to decide what I'm going to do with my summer. Maybe Norway, maybe a day camp with Brian and Kaitlin, maybe Kenzie's again. 

There are only 46 or so days of school left. Nutso. 

Life is good :)
My birthday is in two weeks from tomorrow and last night I learned to play the saw.

Jason Bishop added me as a friend on MySpace. I almost had a heart attack. I haven't ever cried so hard in my entire life, except maybe the day I found out that he wasn't going to come home after he left. 
He's alive and doing well, and I coudln't be happier than I am in this moment.

Finally finished putting up all of the various things I like having on my walls. There wasn't room for everything I brought, but I've got most of the best stuff up there, and now I'm happy with the way my walls look. 

I re-read the artcles  about Mr. Schofield in the RT Magazine (Middletown High's newspaper) from November 2004. Every now and then I remember how amazing he was, and get a little sad, but also get really happy. I was really lucky to have gotten to know him. 

I've been talking to my father a lot more, via e-mail and letters, mostly, and I just don't know what I'd do if he were to die as suddenly as Schodawg did. He is so, so important to me. As is my mother, my brother, and many other people in my life. Sometimes I feel like I take friendships for granted. I hope everyone I care about knows that I care about them. I wouldn't be who I am today without the influence of lots of people. 

Speaking of people I care about, Laurel is coming here today! The bus she was on last night broke down around 10 pm, so she's getting here later than expected, but it shouldn't be too late. I'm so excited. I haven't seen her since December 26th. That's too long. I feel like our relationship thrives when we've got a little distance between us, but 2 months and an ocean apart is a bit much. 

It's lunch time, but I'm not hungry and I still have laundry in the dryer. I'll walk to the dining hall, anyway. 

<3

I just took a bath in my resident director's tub. It was amaaaazing. Gawd I love soaking in bubbles. 

Tonight I'm going to do math homework and trim Kaitlin's hair. Girl's night is Tuesday and volunteering at the Vietnam Vet's center is Wendesday. Laurel may be coming on Friday, but I have to confirm the details with her. 

Life is pretty good here at Wilson. Good people, better food than Hood, and fantastic hiking all around. Friday I went to the coffee house at the cafe here on campus, and in the end it turned into one huuuge dance party. It was pretty indredible. And today John and I absolutely rocked out to Bohemian Rhapsody on the way back from the bookstore. 

I think one of the best things, though, is that if I have anything I need to get off my chest, or if I just feel like I need a hug, I have people everywhere that I can turn to without feeling like I have to explian myself. I had a lot of that in Frederick, but it just seems to be magnified here. 

Oh, aaaand a guy I work with can play the saw, and is going to teach me how to do it. Yesss.

I am so tired but not
able to sleep for
my left foot has done so.


I fucking love my new school.

I love Star kids and everything associated with Star.I love meeting fabulous people randomly on trains in big cities and having conversations that resemble those that I've had with people I've known for years. 
I adore Jeff and milkshakes and not getting out of bed until noon. I love writing lyrics in the sand with my feet. 
I love the Golden Girls.

I had the best Christmas of my life this year. Spent the day with my family, then came home and cleaned a little and had nearly every Record and Tape Traders employee come over(most with instruments in tow). Jeff and Liz came too, and it was simply amazing. 

Speaking of Jeff, he's been simply amazing. This is the first relationship I've had that's been so simple and just...nice. He's so very wonderful.

I've been watching the third season of the Golden Girls for the past week and I got the second season from my parents, aaaand the fourth season is en route from the Towson Record and Tape store, so um, I'm gonna be doing good for quite a while. Maybe I'll have a Golden Girls Marathon. It's too bad that I can't get paid to watch my four favorite TV ladies.

Tomorrow I'm getting my first (real) tattoo. I'm excited and nervous.  Hopefully the guy giving it to me won't botch it up or anything. That would suck. 

Laurel left for the airport 7 minutes ago. She'll be in India for four whole weeks. Golly. 

Alrighty, it's time for me brush my teeth and clothe myself. Au revoir!

I have a paper to write. It was due last Monday. The latest I can get it done is Tuesday morning. I really want to get it done now, But I have absolutely no motovation. Which is very, very bad. 

Energy drinks really do seem to work. I have no intentions of drinking another one, though, 'cause they taste awful. 

Sometimes I wish that everything I think could be recorded somehow. Like, every little thing. And then I could go back over it, if I wanted, to remember the really good things that I thought about before. 

Tomorrow I get to see Jeff. I'm excited about that. I am so looking forward to just lying in bed with him while listening to music. 

I am not exited about my performance on my American Dream in Liturature final. I don't actually know how I did, but I definietly don't feel too great about what I wrote in that dumb blue book. And I really really hate wide-ruled paper. 

I need to write letters, wrap some and find more gifts, WRITE THIS DAMN PAPER, and sometime soon get a full night's sleep. Oh and save the world from certain doom and all of that other stuff. 

Um kay that's the end.
Life changes, and it always does it quickly.

Got hired at Are and Tee Tee. Which is really good, 'cause today Mike called and told me that Kenzie's is closing for the winter. Just in time, eh?

Today I skipped class to go to the Visionary Art Museum with Jeff(e). It was fabulous. I wish I could stop real life and make something inspirational. 

Did you know that when Canada geese honk while flying, it's to encourage the goose that's flying up front? And that if one goose gets injured, two healthy geese will stop migrating to be with injured goose until it gets better?

I wish people were like that. 

We watched a video on screen painters of Baltimore and there was this one elderly gentleman talking about how when he goes to heaven, God will hand him a paint brush and he'll get to paint the clouds. That brought me to tears. 

Aimee, Julia, and Angel are all watching the Victoria's Secret runway show. I don't really get how a woman with a real body and real mind could watch that sort of thing without being offended. The girls who model underwear and lingere are completely objectified, and subject to mountains of criticism. Not to mention the whole setting the standards of "beauty" higher than any real human being could possibly reach. 

To each their own, I suppose. 

My procrastination has got to end here.

There are probably 1400 words I could use to describe how I feel right now. About life, love, friendship, family, education, careers, music...everything. 

My life is so undecided right now. Meh. 

I have an interview at Record and Tape Traders tomorrow. Hopefully I'll get the job and make a little more mula. 

Blah blah blah. 

Bedtime.

American ZeroLtJ: yo doooouuuuuaaaaawg
youare so needed: hey darlin'
American ZeroLtJ: that wasn't very home slice of you...
youare so needed: no, I'm not too gangster
American ZeroLtJ: but yeah, I'm actually going to bed right now cause its late and I just needed to finish up some painting.
American ZeroLtJ: but I popped in to say "boogily woogily" and "I think you're just darling"
youare so needed: that's perfectly lovely of you!
youare so needed: especially the "boogily woogliy" bit
American ZeroLtJ: I try...I'm pretty gangster
youare so needed: we're just on opposite ends of the spectrum I guess
American ZeroLtJ: opposites attract
youare so needed: touche!
youare so needed: it looks like we were meant to be
youare so needed: we'll just have to face the facts
American ZeroLtJ: yup
youare so needed: if we had kids, what would they be like?
American ZeroLtJ: one would be bob ross
American ZeroLtJ: pauly shores
youare so needed: baaahahaha
American ZeroLtJ: and I think the other would be a mix between torrie spelling and the rock
youare so needed: Omg
youare so needed: let's have so many babies
American ZeroLtJ: I have to be honest...pauly shores would be my favorite....the other two I really probably would be to fond of
American ZeroLtJ: or emotionally supportive of
youare so needed: haha
American ZeroLtJ: ....I just really don't like torrie spelling
American ZeroLtJ: is the main thing
American ZeroLtJ: ....I'd probably snuff that one out
youare so needed: well
youare so needed: that one can be my prize child
youare so needed: the spelling bee winner
youare so needed: and chess champion
youare so needed: not that I can play chess
American ZeroLtJ: we'll have to have bobby fisher as a child to teach her how to play chess
youare so needed: oh good call
youare so needed: and then she'll exceed his talents
American ZeroLtJ: and bobby will go crazy and run off into the woods
youare so needed: disappear like he always does
American ZeroLtJ: cause a horse got better at chess than he did
youare so needed: our torrie spelling child will be no horse!
American ZeroLtJ: shes a horse anyways! its in her genetics
youare so needed: You're talking about our daughter!
American ZeroLtJ: I told you I wasn't going to be emotionally supportive of her...its your prize child
youare so needed: dammit, Matt
American ZeroLtJ: I wanted to snuff her out
American ZeroLtJ: but you haaaad to keep her
youare so needed: hey
youare so needed: if a child comes outta my body and half of her is made of me, I'm not gonna ignore her
youare so needed: unless we're doing it in a test tube 
youare so needed: and then I guess we can snuff her out
American ZeroLtJ: well I was going to say the other half didn't come from me cause...I'm not a horse
youare so needed: you think I'd cheat on you?
youare so needed: Matthew Gibb
youare so needed: I am as loyal as fish are to water
American ZeroLtJ: oh noooo I would never. and I mean that seriously
American ZeroLtJ: but we are talking about having childern that have already been born to other people
American ZeroLtJ: so you have to work with me here
youare so needed: oh
youare so needed: true that
American ZeroLtJ: see I knew there was some gangster in there somewhere
youare so needed: oh no
youare so needed: I didn't say true dat
youare so needed: true that
youare so needed: I've still got my "th"s
American ZeroLtJ: but its getting there
American ZeroLtJ: because a really pasty mcwhitebread would have said "capital point my dear fellow"
youare so needed: bahaha
youare so needed: you are positively correct
American ZeroLtJ: and "true that" is waaaaaay closer to "true dat" than "I do say, that was an excelent observation mr. jones macarthy the 4th"
youare so needed: But Matt
youare so needed: your name isn't Mr. Jones Macarthy IV
youare so needed: what's your middle name?
American ZeroLtJ: that would be really cool if it was...if I was truly a mcwhitey
American ZeroLtJ: Harrison
American ZeroLtJ: thats the kind of middle name that shit inspires fear in enemies
youare so needed: Matthew Harrison Gibb
youare so needed: yeah I can see someone peeing their pants after hearing that
American ZeroLtJ: alright, I just got my away message for the night, I'm going to bed.
youare so needed: hahaha
youare so needed: sweet dreams Macarthy IV
American ZeroLtJ: good night jamaule williams
I love people that love me for who I am and not who they want me to be.

I think my last fish is going to die. He hasn't got the spunk he usually does. 

Election daaaay. Gonna vote? I'm gonna vote. For the first time. Woo. 

Joanna Newsom is playing at the Black Cat on November 17th. Does anyone want to go with me? 

I have so much shit to do and only a week to do it all. Crapola. Staff infection/meeting this weekend, though. Looking forward to that. 

Kay the end.

My procrastination habit really is a terrible thing. I've been home for three hours and I haven't worked on any of my homework. Dear me. 

Gonna carve pumpkins tonight with Jon. It's gonna be fuuun.
My love is a life taker.
Jeffrey won Project Runway, and I kind of want to cry.
Sleepless in Seattle is quite possibly one of the best movies ever.

My house smells sickly sweet. I think it's the air freshener that Aimee put in...one of those plug-it-in ones that saturate the air with way too intense fragrance. Yuck. Other than that, things are good right now. I miss this: and this: Staph infection (aka staff meeting) in ONE MONTH. And my trip to Vermonty in TWO WEEKS. And I see Jenny Lewis with Grant on Sunday. Glorious things, all of 'em. OH. Joanna Newsom is coming to the Black Cat November the 17th. Anyone wanna go with Mathew and I? I'm super excited.
I think I'm in love with Ethan Embry.

Yesterday was wicked busy, and today hasn't been much different.
Woke up at 5:30 yesterday to go to Michele and Andy's re-affirmation of their wedding vows. It was really, really cold and it rained a little bit, but it was beautiful and my mom and I cried a lot. After we hung out there for a couple hours we went to the LDC in Baltimore and lead a workshop. It was really sort of strange to be there. Only a handful of youth knew me, but almost all of the advisors did. On top of that, LDC had been my first con 5 years ago. Woah. 
Anyway, that went really well and then we drove home and visited with my mom's cousin Eric, who was visiting from Japan. He's really cool. Merrill and I decided that we're going to visit him sometime soon, just the two of us. You know, some awesome sister-brother-second cousin bonding. It's gonna sweet. 
Today I babysat Zoleigh from 10 to 12 and Amelie from 12:30 to 4, and I have work in a half hour. Whew. 
I need to do laundry and make myself some grub to take to work. 
Looove.

My poor fish! He was acting all out of sorts; not eating, not swimming around...pretty much just not being a healthy fish. And now he's dead. Sad things. 

I, on the other hand, though swamped with homework that I put off, am quite alive. Thank goodness. 

I love Mathew Hluch and I hope we're friends forever. 

End transmission.

I got like, 5 hours of sleep yesterday. So tonight at like, 1:30, the lack of sleep plus a glass of wine made me loopy. 

Aimee made mac and cheese, and before she put the noodles in the pot, (a very drunk) Jacob looked at the boiling water and said,"Mmm, looks good." I haven't laughed so hard at anything ever. 

I love Aimee and Donna and Amanda and Mathew and Megan. Yay.

Julia is in the kitchen making all kinds of noise doing who knows what. I'm kind of curious to find out, but I don't really want the fantasy that she's decided to become a pastry chef and wants me to try all of her cakes and cream puffs to go away. 

On Saturday my dad came over and looked at my computer and the van (I thought there were things wrong with both of them, and they were both okay. Which is good.) and bought me a tank of gas. I love my dad, a lot(and not just 'cause he buys me petrol). He's always so supportive. I really lucked out on the parents deal. Mine are both amazing. 

Speaking of my mom, she called me today and asked if I thought it was a good idea for her to skip her Spanish class. I got a kick outta that. 

I really want to figure out what my interests are. I don't really feel passionate about anything that I could take classes for, and it sort of worries me. I'm supposed to declare a major in 8 months, and I don't even know what I'm interested in. Meh. 

I'll figure something out, I guess.

I have lots of homework and eating dinner to do.

It's a wet day. Was gonna wear my glorious rain boots, but decided not to, only to see two girls on campus wearing equally fabulous rain boots. I felt sort of bad for not representin'.

Things with boys keep getting more confusing. Story of my life.

Professor Sor (my Spanish professor from last semester-aka-the worst teacher I've ever had) hangs around the commuter lounge a lot and tries to make conversation. Awkward.

The van is having work done on it today...hopefully done by tomorrow. I never realize how much I love having a vehicle until it's not available for use. Meh. 

Grant(y Smith Apples) and I are going to see Jenny Lewis on October 15th at 930. We've also decided to convince her to come to Star. It'll be good. 

Umm the end.

So you know when you're drinking something and then someone makes you laugh and whatever you were drinking goes up yr nose? 

Last night I discovered that it works with rice, too.
I really, really love when hugging someone makes me giddy.

EnvisionSkater: he was crazy he was holding his child while feeding a crocodile
youare so needed: that's like MJ holding his baby over the balcony
youare so needed: you just can't do stuff like that
EnvisionSkater: haha true
EnvisionSkater: but mj's line of work isn't as dangerous as steve irwins
EnvisionSkater: but nonetheless still crazy
youare so needed: ha ha, that's very true
EnvisionSkater: if mj held a baby while doing the moonwalk they wouldn't look down on him 


Greg and I have stimulating conversations.

So hanging out with Jon last night turned into going to the Coffee Co. to see (amazing) Adrienne Smith play while waiting for Jon to call, never hearing from him, and then running into Mathew Hluch, Meg M., and Greg Bender. We went back to Greg's apartment and had (at least!) a four hour dance party. It was prett much amazing. 
Everyone left around 2:30, and then (a drunk)Greg and I talked some while we waited for his friend Grant to go to another party, which was dead by the time we got there. So I drove Greg home and got to sleep sometime around 3:30. Woke up at 11 today. Wicked late for me. 

Today I'm going to do homework and maybe hang out with Greg again before work, then getting off work and calling Meg. Excitiiing. 

And now it's time to take a shower and do some homework, which, of course, will be riveting.

So, despite some trouble with text book confusion, the first week of school went well. I've got a new friend, new aquaintences, fabulous professors who teach really well, and a workload that's larger than what I've had in the past, but I'm ready and willing to tackle. 

I talked to my amazing friend Frans (with whom I went to third grade) the other day. We've decided that we're going to get married and possibly live in the Netherlands. Sounds good to me.

Tonight I'm hanging out with Jon, and probably doing homework afterward. Woo!

<3

School has been okay. My American dream in liturature and women studies classes are both great, and both taught by the same professor. Even my science (biodiversity) and math (stats) classes shouldn't be terrible. This semester will be hard work, but I'm totally willing to do it (woo!). 

I'm in a weird place right now with a couple people. That funny place where I think I like them and am interested in persuing some sort of romantic relationship, but I'm not quite sure. I'll have to see how they play out. 

A girl moved in to the empty room today, so now it's not empty. Her name is Julia something or other. She's dating the boy that I went on my first real date with. Small world.

I need to clean the fish bowls.

Amy Kane is sitting on my bed, and we're talking to Matt Gibb via speaker phone. Grant Hamming is coming up tomorrow for a hike and a swim and I am very, very happy about all of the previously stated things.

Martin sent me a text last night and asked to hang out, so um, I think we're going to go fishing  this weekend. Which is kind of cool. 

School on Monday. Yuck. But I've met a few freshman who seem really cool, and I'm only going to be at Hood (hopefully!) for this one semester, so it shouldn't be terrible.

Matt Gibb is talking about making bean dip. "Matt Gibb loves the meat!" Amy Kane just said that. Gloooory!

Oh, now we're going to eat ice cream (some soy and some not) and watch High Fidelity and snuggle on my bed and be way in love. 

Yay!

The past few days have been pretty eventful, which has been very nice. Hanging out with Mathew and Megan and Mathew's awesome friend Chris, with Laurel and Nick and Nick's friend Mike, and with Paddy. Oh, and Colin and Dustin and Cori and David and Patrik. 
 That's a lot of people. 

I started filling out my staff application today. Gotta finish writing it, and then type it up to send on in to Sarah D'. Aaand I have to get started on my application essays for them Vermonty schools. Ooooh goodness I'm excited about Vermont. 

School starts in...very soon. I've gotten most of my books and know my schedule and all that jazz. But school starting school again is not the best thing ever.
